verses.verse: And after this<WH310> it came to pass<WH1732>, that David smote<WH5221> the Philistines<WH6430>, and subdued<WH3665> them<WH3947>, and took Gath<WH1661> and its towns<WH1323> out of the hand<WH3027> of the Philistines<WH6430>.
And he smote<WH5221> Moab<WH4124>; and the Moabites<WH4124> became servants<WH5650> to David<WH1732>, and brought<WH5375> tribute<WH4503>.

And David<WH1732> smote<WH5221> Hadarezer<WH1928> king<WH4428> of Zobah<WH6678> unto Hamath<WH2574>, as he went<WH3212> to establish<WH5324> his dominion<WH3027> by the river<WH5104> Euphrates<WH6578>.

And David<WH1732> took<WH3920> from him a thousand<WH505> chariots<WH7393>, and seven<WH7651> thousand<WH505> horsemen<WH6571>, and twenty<WH6242> thousand<WH505> footmen<WH376>; and David<WH1732> hocked<WH6131> all the chariot<WH7393> horses<WH3498>, but reserved of them for a hundred<WH3967> chariots<WH7393>.
And when the Syrians of Damascus came to succor Hadarezer king of Zobah, David smote of the Syrians two and twenty thousand men.

Then David<WH1732> put<WH7760> garrisons in Syria<WH758> of Damascus<WH758>; and the Syrians became servants<WH5650> to David<WH1732>, and brought<WH5375> tribute<WH4503>. And Jehovah<WH3068> gave victory<WH3467> to David<WH1732> whithersoever he went<WH1980>.
And David<WH1732> took<WH3947> the shields<WH7982> of gold<WH2091> that were on the servants<WH5650> of Hadarezer<WH1928>, and brought<WH935> them to Jerusalem<WH3389>.

And from Tibhath<WH2880> and from Cun<WH3560>, cities<WH5892> of Hadarezer<WH1928>, David<WH1732> took<WH3947> very<WH3966> much<WH7227> brass<WH5178>, wherewith Solomon<WH8010> made<WH6213> the brazen<WH5178> sea<WH3220>, and the pillars<WH5982>, and the vessels<WH3627> of brass<WH5178>.
And when Tou<WH8583> king<WH4428> of Hamath<WH2574> heard<WH8085> that David<WH1732> had smitten<WH5221> all the host<WH2428> of Hadarezer<WH1928> king<WH4428> of Zobah<WH6678>,

he sent<WH7971> Hadoram<WH1913> his son<WH1121> to king<WH4428> David<WH1732>, to salute<WH7592> him<WH7965>, and to bless<WH1288> him<WH3898>, because he had fought against Hadarezer<WH1928> and smitten<WH5221> him<WH1928>; (for Hadarezer had wars<WH376> with Tou<WH8583>;) and he had with him all manner of vessels<WH3627> of gold<WH2091> and silver<WH3701> and brass<WH5178>.

These also did king<WH4428> David<WH1732> dedicate<WH6942> unto Jehovah<WH3068>, with the silver<WH3701> and the gold<WH2091> that he carried<WH5375> away from all the nations<WH1471>; from Edom<WH123>, and from Moab<WH4124>, and from the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983>, and from the Philistines<WH6430>, and from Amalek<WH6002>.
Moreover Abishai<WH52> the son<WH1121> of Zeruiah<WH6870> smote<WH5221> of the Edomites<WH123> in the Valley<WH1516> of Salt<WH4417> eighteen<WH8083> thousand<WH505>.

And he put<WH7760> garrisons<WH5333> in Edom<WH123>; and all the Edomites<WH123> became servants<WH5650> to David<WH1732>. And Jehovah<WH3068> gave victory<WH3467> to David<WH1732> whithersoever he went<WH1980>.
And David<WH1732> reigned<WH4427> over all Israel<WH3478>; and he executed<WH6213> justice<WH4941> and righteousness<WH6666> unto all his people<WH5971>.
And Joab<WH3097> the son<WH1121> of Zeruiah<WH6870> was over the host<WH6635>; and Jehoshaphat<WH3092> the son<WH1121> of Ahilud<WH286> was recorder<WH2142>;
and Zadok<WH6659> the son<WH1121> of Ahitub<WH285>, and Abimelech<WH40> the son<WH1121> of Abiathar<WH54>, were priests<WH3548>; and Shavsha<WH7798> was scribe<WH5608>;

and Benaiah<WH1141> the son<WH1121> of Jehoiada<WH3077> was over the Cherethites<WH3774> and the Pelethites<WH6432>; and the sons<WH1121> of David<WH1732> were chief<WH7223> about<WH3027> the king<WH4428>.
